title: Nvidia to take $1 billion Nokia stake, supply network AI Chips
description: Nvidia Corp. is taking a $1 billion equity stake in Nokia Oyj and plans to supply the telecom company with artificial-intelligence-powered computers for wireless networks. Nokia shares jumped the most in more than a decade. Nokia will issue about 166 million shares to Nvidia at $6.01 each as part of the deal, giving Nvidia a 2.9% stake, the companies said in a statement. Nvidia’s chips will be used to accelerate Nokia’s software for 5G and 6G networks, and Nvidia will explore ways to use Nokia’s data centre technology in its own AI infrastructure, they said.
content:
Once an iconic 1990s brand that dominated the mobile phone market, Nokia has faded from popular culture after losing ground to rivals and pivoting to network services.
By Bloomberg

title: Nvidia's stock market value nears record $5 trillion
description: Nvidia was on the verge of becoming the first company worth $5 trillion on Tuesday after the heavyweight chipmaker said it had $500 billion in bookings for its artificial intelligence processors.

title: Amazon to cut about 14,000 corporate jobs in AI push
description: Amazon reduces its global corporate workforce by about 14,000 people, with more cuts expected next year, in a major shakeup driven in part by adoption of artificial intelligence
content:
Amazon said on Tuesday, October 28, it will reduce its global corporate workforce by about 14,000 people, with more cuts expected next year, in a major shakeup driven in part by adoption of artificial intelligence at the tech giant.

title: Donald Trump expects lower fentanyl tariff, Nvidia talks with Xi Jinping
description: Donald Trump said he expects to lower the tariffs the US has imposed on Chinese goods over the fentanyl crisis and speak with China’s Xi Jinping about Nvidia Corp.’s flagship Blackwell artificial intelligence chip, as leaders of the world’s biggest economies seek to ease tensions in a meeting on Thursday. “I expect to be lowering that because I believe they’re going to help us with the fentanyl situation,” Trump told reporters on Air Force One as he headed to South Korea on Wednesday
content:
Trump said he expected Beijing would be “doing things” and work with him directly to address the export of precursor chemicals critical to manufacturing fentanyl. He didn’t provide further details on the magnitude of the tariff reduction.
